column5: She just roared over my house at 11:50. It's nice to see (and hear) her return safely home. She's probably on the runway now.
Have a great time with her !
Have a great time with her !  Definitely would be a blast, any suggestions for a bombing run ?
Have a great time with her !  I've been saving my nickles and dimes for a long time in hopes to spend 30 minutes with her.
I heard it as well! What a trip that would be from England back. Any odd sound and the heart would pound a little heavier. 4 engines notwithstanding.
An historic event has now concluded and destined for the history books I would think.  http://www.thespec.com/news-story/4885028-hamilton-s-lanc-returns-safe-and-sound-to-cheering-crowd/

I saw the plane fly over the golf course in Thunder Bay a few years ago, it sure was a great sight. can you imagine the noise produced by the hundreds of them going into battle, must have been awesome.
Aha! I thought so! She woke my wife and I up last last because it sounded like a tractor trailer driving past our bedroom window. We thought Vera? Nah, she's in England. Lol
Good to hear first hand that she's home safe and sound!

She just roared over my house at 11:50.  She must have come in from the south. I was in the backyard all day. Never heard a thing. Glad she made it home. A special piece of history right in with a special place right in our backyards.
Flew directly over our place in Pickering this morning, the sound of four RR Merlins was sweet music!
That's awesome !!! Saw her on the news !!!!! What a piece of history !!!!!! And yes she is ours forever !!!! A national treasure !!!!!  )
